_header: How mankind doth begin / Is wonder for to scrive so

OxfBal354.First Lines:
How that Mankynd doth be gynneYt ys a wonder for to discrye
                    sooIn game he ys getyn In syneThe child ys the moders Dedely
                    foo…
OxfBal354.Last Lines:
…My redy speche may not lastffor my tothes they fall me
                    fro

Early Manuscripts at Oxford University: Facsimile

CamMagPep2125.First Lines:
Howe mankynde doþ begynneIs wonder to discryue
                    so…
CamMagPep2125.Last Lines:
…Withoute synne þider to wendeWith loue to se his faire
                    face
CamMagPep2125.Note: Written two lines of verse per line of MS.
CamMagPep2125.Attributed Title:
Here bygynneþ materes of ȝouþe & of age And of vertues
                    & of vices Wyþ her kyndely condicions (f. 60v)

HunHM135.First Lines:
…Go from me & make the a frereMyn age ys nowe in xl
                    ȝere…
HunHM135.Last Lines:
…Wyth outen synne thedyr to wendeWyth loue to sen that fayre
                    face
HunHM135.Note:
Begins imperfectly at line 288; ends ‘Amen’ after last line
                    above, then below the colophon, ‘Here ys wryten how mankynde dothe wende /
                    Wanne the lyf ys browȝt to the ende’ (f. 86v), then
                        ‘Explicit totu’.
